snippet: Slowdowns in Russia and China have put energy deals between the countries in question, affecting the once-vaunted relationship between the two leaders.
abstract: Faltering economies of both China and Russia are testing once-vaunted relationship between Chinese Pres Xi Jinping and Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin; Russia, which had sought safeguards in bilateral trade with China in effort to counterbalance effect of Western economic sanctions and global slide in oil prices, has been faced with reality of China's economic limitations; situation has been exacerbated by effects of China's turbulent stock market.

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and NEIL MacFARQUHAR
byline.contributor: Jane Perlez reported from Beijing, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Slowdowns in Russia and China have put energy deals between the countries in question, affecting the once-vaunted relationship between the two leaders.

headline.main: Friendship Between Putin and Xi Becomes Strained as Economies Falter
headline.print_headline: Rocky Economy Tests Friendship of Xi and Putin
